greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the number of iterations of k -> A064916(k) to reach a prime, starting at n.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
program: (PARI) lpf(n)= { local(f); f=factor(n); return(f[1, 1]) } { for (n=2, 1000, m=n; a=0; while (!isprime(m), L=lpf(m); m=m / L + L - 1; a++); write("b064918.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Sep 29 2009
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 14 2001
